title: To add the Deposit permission:
instruction: If you want to record a customer deposit, follow the preceding steps but select the Customer Deposit permission. To record a customer deposit, see Recording a Customer Deposit.

output.meta: How should related articles be handled?

steps.instruction: Log in as an administrator.
steps.meta: Unsure: Don't know how to login (need to see the UI)

steps.instruction: Go to Setup > Users/Roles > Manage Roles.
steps.description: Go to the Manage Roles page

steps.instruction: On the Manage Roles page, click Edit next to the custom role you want to modify.

output.meta: How to pick the exact role?

steps.instruction: On the Permissions subtab of the Role page, look for the Transactions sublist.
From the dropdown list in the Permission column, select Deposit.

output.meta: How to pick the exact permission? Used second param to specify the permission

steps.instruction: From the dropdown list in the Level column, select the level of access for the permission.
steps.description: Set the level of access for the permission

steps.instruction: Click OK.
Click Save.

title: To make a deposit:
description: How to make a Deposit

steps.description: Go to the Make Deposits page
steps.instruction: Go to Transactions > Bank > Make Deposits.
In the Primary Information section:
steps.description: Fill out the Primary Information section

steps.instruction:
Select the custom form for this deposit.

The system generated deposit number appears.

Select the bank account for the deposit.

The currency and exchange rate display for the account. For information about exchange rates, see Currency Exchange Rates.

If the bank account's currency is the same as the subsidiary's base currency, the exchange rate is a read-only field
The Amount field shows the total amount of payments, other deposits, and cash back selected or entered on the Deposits subtab.

steps.description: Set the date of the deposit
steps.instruction: Accept today's date, or enter the date of the deposit.
Select a posting period, if you use the Accounting Periods feature.
Optionally, enter a memo.

steps.description: Check the To Be Printed box
steps.instruction: Check the To Be Printed box if you want to enter multiple deposits before printing the deposit slips for your records. See Printing Multiple Deposit Slips.

In the Classification section, select a department, class, and location for this deposit, if needed.

If you use NetSuite OneWorld, the subsidiary defaults to that associated with the selected bank account.
On the Deposits subtab, enter the items for the deposit.
steps.description: Enter the items for the deposit

steps.instruction:
The Payments subtab lists all payments posted to the Undeposited Funds account. Check the box next to each item to include in this deposit.

You can filter the items by date, date range, or payment processing profile.

The Amount column shows the payment amount in the currency of the bank account, which was entered when received for a cash sale, invoice, or other transaction. If you must change the amount, click the link in the Date column to go to the source transaction.

If the field is empty, you must manually enter the amount. NetSuite does not populate the field if the payment currency is different from the bank account’s currency, and the bank and subsidiary currencies are also different.

If the payment currency is different from the bank’s currency, and the bank and subsidiary currencies are the same, NetSuite uses the stored exchange rate to calculate the amount.
steps.description: Select payments to include in the deposit
steps.meta: Unsure, please check this one. Do we need a for loop?

steps.instruction:
On the Other Deposits subtab, enter items not received as payments recorded to the Undeposited Funds account.

Enter the name, amount (positive number), account, payment method, and payment number for each item. Optionally enter a classification and memo. Click Add.
On the Cash Back subtab, enter the amount of cash back you received from this deposit. Enter the amount of cash you received, account, classification, and memo. Click Add.
On the Communication subtab, you can attach files and notes to this transaction.
steps.description: Attach files and notes to the deposit
Add a note to the deposit
steps.instruction: On the User Notes subtab, enter a title and note for any comments you want to add to this transaction. Click Add after each note
On the Files subtab, select and attach files from the File Cabinet related to this transaction. To upload a new file to the File Cabinet, select New from the dropdown list in the Attach Files column.

Use the Events, Tasks, and Phone Calls subtabs to add to attach activities, such as events, phone calls, and tasks to this transaction. For more information, see Attaching Events, Tasks, and Calls to Records and Transactions.
steps.description: Attach events, tasks, and phone calls to the deposit
steps.meta: Unsure, please check this one: I don't think we have enough information for this

steps.instruction: If you use NetSuite OneWorld and the Multi-Book Accounting feature is provisioned in your account, the Accounting Books subtab appears. This subtab shows the secondary books associated with the selected deposit, if any, and their respective base currencies and exchange rates. For information about Multi-Book Accounting, see Using Multi-Book Accounting.
steps.description: View the accounting books associated with the deposit

steps.instruction: After you enter all the items for the deposit, verify the deposit total amount is correct and click Save.

title: To edit a saved deposit in the Deposits list:
description: Edit a saved deposit

steps.instruction: Go to Transactions > Bank > Make Deposits > List.
From the Deposits list, click Edit next to the deposit you want to modify.
steps.description: Click Edit next to the deposit you want to modify

steps.instruction: On the Deposit page, modify the saved deposit as required.
steps.description: Modify the saved deposit as required
steps.meta: Unsure, please check this one: What can be modified?

steps.instruction:
Click Save.

If you modified the deposit amount, a prompt to unreconcile the transaction appears. Click OK. Open the correct statement period for the transaction and reconcile the transaction again.

title: To delete an existing deposit from the Deposits list:
description: Delete a deposit

steps.instruction: Go to Transactions > Bank > Make Deposits > List.
From the Deposits list, click Edit next to the deposit you want to delete.
steps.description: Click Edit next to the deposit you want to delete

steps.instruction: On the Deposit page, under Actions, click Delete.
At the prompt to confirm the action, click OK.

title: To enter a funds transfer:
description: Enter a funds transfer

steps.instruction: Go to Transactions > Bank > Transfer Funds.
steps.description: Go to the Transfer Funds page

steps.instruction:
In the From Account field, select the source account containing the funds that you want to transfer.

The balance of this account and its currency denomination appear next to the From Account field.
steps.description: Select the source account containing the funds that you want to transfer

steps.instruction:
In the To Account field, select the target account to receive the funds.

The balance of this account and its currency denomination appear next to the To Account field. The Exchange Rate between the currencies in the two accounts displays below the two currency denominations.
steps.description: Select the target account to receive the funds

steps.instruction:
Select the posting period for this transfer.

The period must be an open period.
steps.description: Select the posting period for this transfer

steps.instruction: Accept or select the date in the Date field.
steps.description: Accept or select the date in the Date field

steps.instruction:
In the top Amount field, enter the amount of funds, in the account's currency, to be transferred from the account identified in the From Account field.

The second Amount field displays the amount to be transferred into the account identified in the To Account field, after currency translation.
steps.description: Enter the amount of funds to transfer

steps.instruction: Enter an optional memo.
Enter a department, class, or location if appropriate.
steps.description: Enter a department, class, or location if appropriate

steps.instruction: Click Save.

title: To record cash back from a deposit:
description: How to record cash back from a deposit

steps.instruction: Go to Transactions > Bank > Make Deposits.
Create a deposit. For more information, see Making Deposits.
steps.meta: Do we want to have an action for going to another page? Can produce loops. But, too much involved for this 1 step otherwise.

steps.instruction: Click the Cash Back subtab.
In the Amount field, enter the amount of cash you got back.
steps.description: Enter the amount of cash you got back

steps.instruction: Select the account the deposit comes from.
steps.description: Select the account the deposit comes from

steps.instruction: Select a department, class or location.
steps.description: Select a department, class or location

steps.instruction: Enter an optional memo.

Click Add.

Repeat the steps above for any other cash items you received from deposits.
steps.meta: Do we want a looping action?

steps.instruction: Click Save.

title: To void a check:
description: How to void a check

steps.instruction: Go to Transactions > Bank > Write Checks > List.
steps.description: Go to Transactions > Bank > Write Checks > List

steps.instruction: Click the Edit link for the check to be voided.
steps.description: Click the Edit link for the check to be voided

steps.instruction:
Click Void.

If you are voiding this check with a reversing journal entry, the Voiding Journal page appears. Click Save.

The system sets the check’s status to Voided and records a journal entry with an opposite amount that cancels out the general ledger impact of the check. For more information on creating a journal entry, see Making Journal Entries.

If you are voiding this check without a reversing journal entry, the system sets the status to Voided and sets the transaction amount to zero. If the check was previously cleared, a confirmation window appears warning you that voiding the check may cause an inconsistency in your account reconciliation, like an incorrect balance. The check becomes unreconciled if previously reconciled, and the check is unmatched or has its cleared status removed. You can click Cancel to not void the check or click OK to void the check.
steps.meta: Currently choosing one thing, but there are two options. Do we want to have a branching action?

title: To reset check numbering:
description: How to reset check numbering

steps.instruction: Go to Lists > Accounting > Accounts, or Setup > Accounting > Chart of Accounts.
steps.description: Go to Lists > Accounting > Accounts, or Setup > Accounting > Chart of Accounts
steps.meta: Currently choosing one thing, but there are two options. Do we want to have a branching action?

steps.instruction: In the list of accounts, click Edit next to the bank account for which you want to reset check numbering.
steps.description: Click Edit next to the account

steps.instruction: In the Next Check Number field, enter the check number to use for the next check written from this account.
Click Save.

title: To enter non-check debit transactions:

steps.instruction: Go to Transactions > Bank > Write Checks.
On the Check page, verify that the correct bank account appears in the Account field.
steps.meta: Should this do anything? Thought no, but it could focus the field

steps.instruction: Enter the payment information in the appropriate fields.
steps.meta: Do we want to reference another action here? Otherwise, we need to add a lot of steps, and I don't know what's involved

steps.instruction: In the Check Number field, enter Debit or other text to indicate that the payment is not made by a check.
steps.description: Enter Debit in Check Number field

output.meta: Using second param as text to type

steps.instruction:
Click Save.

This debit appears on the register for the account.

title: To enter non-cash debit transactions while reconciling a bank statement:
description: How to enter non-cash debit transactions while reconciling a bank statement

steps.instruction: Go to Transactions > Bank > Reconcile Bank Statement.
steps.description: Go to Reconcile Bank Statement Page

steps.instruction: Click the New Charges subtab.
Fill in the appropriate information for the charge.
steps.meta: Unknown: Charge information

steps.instruction: Click Add.

Complete the rest of the reconciliation.

For complete reconciliation instructions, see Reconciling Bank Statements.

When you have cleared all the transactions listed on the statement and entered any additional transactions, the statement balance and cleared balance should match. Use the Difference field to track your progress.
steps.meta: Unknown: Reconciliation instructions, reference to Reconciling Bank Statements

steps.instruction:
When finished, you can:

  • Click Save to reconcile your bank statement.

  • Click Save & Print to save and print your reconciliation.

  • Click Hold to hold your reconciliation until you return to save or print it.
steps.description: Click Save, Save & Print, or Hold

title: To delete a funds transfer:
description: How to delete a funds transfer

steps.instruction: Go to Transactions > Bank > Transfer Funds > List.
steps.description: Go to Transfer Funds List Page

steps.instruction: From the Transfers list, click Edit next to the funds transfer you want to delete.
steps.description: Click Edit next to funds transfer
steps.meta: Relative positioning? How do we know which funds transfer to delete?

steps.instruction: On the Transfer page, under Actions, click Delete.
At the prompt to confirm the action, click OK.

title: To add a new company credit card account:
description: How to add a new company credit card account

steps.instruction: Go to Setup > Accounting > Manage G/L > Chart of Accounts > New.
steps.description: Go to Chart of Accounts New Page

steps.instruction: In the Type list, select Credit Card.
Enter the number to identify this account.
Enter a name for the account.
Complete other fields as needed.
steps.meta: Unknown other fields

steps.instruction:
If you use NetSuite OneWorld, choose the subsidiary to which this credit card should be assigned.

Credit card accounts can be assigned to only one subsidiary.
Click Save.

title: To modify an existing company credit card account:
description: How to modify an existing company credit card account

steps.instruction: Go to Setup > Accounting > Manage G/L > Chart of Accounts.
steps.description: Go to Chart of Accounts Page

steps.instruction: From the Chart of Accounts, click Edit next to the credit card account you want to modify.

Modify the fields as needed.

You cannot change the currency associated with the account because transactions in this currency exist in the system.

From the Actions menu you can delete the company credit card account or merge the account into another company credit card account.
steps.meta: Unknown fields

steps.instruction: Click Save.

title: To set up issue priorities:
description: How to set up issue priorities

steps.instruction: Go to Issues > Setup > Issue Priorities.
On the Issue Priorities list, click the last row if it is not already selected. This row should be blank.

In the Name column, enter a name for the priority level you want to add. For example, to add to the list of default priorities, you can continue numbering P6, P7, P8, and so on.

This name will be available to select in the Priority field on issue records.
In the Description column, enter a brief description of what types of issues meet this priority level.
Click Add.
Click Save.

title: To set up issue severities:
description: How to set up issue severities

steps.instruction: Go to Issues > Setup > Issue Severities.
On the Issue Severities list, click the last row if it is not already selected. This row should be blank.

In the Name column, enter a descriptive name for the severity level you want to add.

This name will be available to select in the Severity field on issue records.
In the Description column, enter a brief description of what types of issues meet this severity level.
Click Add.
Click Save.

title: To edit a retirement plan:
description: How to edit a retirement plan

steps.instruction: Go to Setup > Payroll > Setup Tasks > Retirement Plans.
Click the number next to the retirement plan you want to edit.
Make your changes.
steps.meta: Unknown fields

steps.instruction: Click Save.

title: To create a payroll item group:
description: How to create a payroll item group

steps.instruction: Go to Lists > Employees > Payroll Item Groups > New.
steps.description: Go to Payroll Item Groups Page

steps.instruction: If you have a OneWorld account, from the Subsidiary list, select a subsidiary.
In the Group Name field, enter a unique and meaningful name for the payroll item group.
steps.description: Enter name for payroll item group

steps.instruction: In the Payroll Items list, select at least two payroll items to include in the payroll item group.
steps.meta: Is this a good way to express the 'at least 2 items' requirement?

steps.instruction: Click Save.

title: To inactivate a payroll item:
description: How to inactivate a payroll item

steps.instruction: Go to Lists > Employees > Payroll Items.
Beside the payroll item that you want to inactivate, click Edit.
steps.meta: Relative Description

steps.instruction: Check the Inactive box.
Click Save.

title: To delete a payroll item:
description: How to delete a payroll item

steps.instruction: Go to Lists > Employees > Payroll Items.
Beside the payroll item that you want to delete, click Edit.
steps.meta: Relative Description

steps.instruction: From the Actions menu, select Delete.

title: To run a paycheck search:
description: How to run a paycheck search

steps.instruction: Go to Reports > New Search.
In the Search list, click Paycheck.

title: To assign a commission plan to a sales rep:
description: How to assign a commission plan to a sales rep

steps.instruction: Go to Lists > Commissions > Employee Plans.
Click Edit next to the commission plan to which you want to assign a sales rep.
steps.meta: Relative Description

steps.instruction: Click the Assign Plan to Sales Reps subtab.
steps.description: Enter Assign Plan to Sales Reps subtab

steps.instruction: In the Sales Rep column, select the sales rep you want to assign to the plan.
In the From column, enter the date this plan begins to calculate commission for this sales rep.
In the To column, enter the last date this plan calculates commission for this sales rep.
Click Add.
Repeat these steps for each sales rep to whom you want to assign this plan.
steps.description: Repeat steps for each sales rep
steps.meta: Do we want a looping action?

steps.instruction: Click Save.

title: To create a commission plan:
description: How to create a commission plan

steps.instruction: Go to Lists > Commissions > Partner Plans > New.
In the Name field, enter a name for this plan.
Enter a description of this plan.
On the Add Schedules to Plan subtab, in the Schedule column, select a schedule to include in this plan.
Click Add.
Repeat steps 4 and 5 for each commission schedule you want to include in this plan.
steps.meta: Do we want a looping action?

steps.instruction: Click the Assign Plan to Partners subtab.
In the Partner column, select a partner to assign to this plan.
In the From column, enter or pick the date this plan takes effect for this partner.
In the To column, enter or pick the last date you want this plan to generate commission for this partner.
Click Add.
Repeat steps 8 - 11 for each partner you want to assign to this plan.
steps.meta: Do we want a looping action?

steps.instruction: Click Save.

title: To assign a commission plan to a partner:
description: Assign a commission plan to a partner

steps.instruction: Go to Lists > Commissions > Partner Plans.
Click Edit next to the commission plan to which you want to assign a partner.
Click the Assign Plan to Partners subtab.
In the Partner column, select the partner you want to assign to the plan.
In the From column, enter the date this plan begins to calculate commission for this partner.
In the To column, enter the last date this plan calculates commission for this partner.
Click Add.
Repeat steps 4 - 7 for each partner to which you want to assign this plan.
steps.meta: Do we want a looping action?

steps.instruction: Click Save.

title: To approve a commission transaction for payment:
description: Approve a commission transaction for payment

steps.instruction:
Go to Transactions > Commissions > Approve Partner Commissions.

The Approve Partner Commissions page displays a list of commission transactions pending approval.
steps.description: Go to the Approve Partner Commissions Page

steps.instruction: In the Approve column, check the box next to the commission transactions to approve, or click Mark All.
steps.description: Check the box next to the commission transactions to approve

steps.instruction: Click Approve.

title: To reject a commission transaction:
description: Reject a commission transaction

steps.instruction:
Go to Transactions > Commissions > Approve Partner Commissions.

The Approve Partner Commissions page displays a list of commission transactions pending approval.
steps.description: Go to the Approve Partner Commissions Page

steps.instruction:
Click Edit next to the commission you want to reject.

The commission transaction opens.
steps.description: Click Edit next to the commission you want to reject

steps.instruction: Click Reject.

title: To copy a project:
description: Copy a project

steps.instruction: Open an existing project in Edit mode.
steps.description: Open an existing project in Edit mode
steps.meta: Not enough information

steps.instruction: Change the Project ID, if not auto-generated, or Project Name.
steps.description: Change the Project ID or Project Name

steps.instruction: You can opt to enter a new project start date. Note that changing this field alone does not enable you to copy a project.
steps.description: Enter a new project start date

steps.instruction: Click Save As in the Save button dropdown .
steps.description: Click Save As in the Save button dropdown

title: Setting a service item to create a project:

steps.instruction: Go to Lists > Accounting > Items. Click Edit next to the service item.
On the item record, click the Related Records subtab.
Click the Projects subtab.
Check the Create Project box.
If you want to use a defined project template for projects created from this service item, select a template in the Project Template field.
If you do not want to use a defined project template, you must define the tasks required to complete the project. For each task, complete the following steps:
In the Task Template Name field, enter the task name. This is the task name that appears on project records created for this item.
In the Start Date Offset field, specify the start date of the tasks relative to the project start date. For example, if the task starts two days after the project start date, enter 2.

In the Effort (hours) field, specify the total number of hours typically required to complete this task. This number of hours is set as the initial time budget for this task on project records created for this item.
Click Add.
Click Save.

title: To set the Consolidate Projects on Sales Transactions preference:

steps.instruction: Go to Setup > Accounting > Preferences > Accounting Preferences. Choose Items/Transactions.

In the Sales & Pricing section, set your preference for consolidating projects based on the information above.

  • Check the Consolidate Projects on Sales Transactions box to enable the preference.

  • Clear the Consolidate Projects on Sales Transactions box to disable the preference.
Click Save.

title: To create an estimate from a project:

steps.instruction: Go to Lists > Relationships > Projects.
Click View next to the project you want to create an estimate from.

On the project record, click Estimate from the New menu.

A new estimate form opens. The customer from the project record autofills on the estimate.

Optionally enter a title for this estimate in the Title field. The estimate title text appears on lists, shows in search and reporting results, and shows on the Estimates subtab of records it is associated with.
Complete the estimate form as necessary. For details, read, Preparing an Estimate.
Click Save.

title: To customize a project form to use CRM tasks:

steps.instruction: Go to Lists > Relationships > Projects and click Edit next to the project.
On the project form, click Customize.
Enter a name for the form.
Click the Fields subtab.
Click the Info subtab.
Check the Show box next to Include CRM Tasks in Job Totals.
Complete other fields on the form as needed.
Click Save.

title: To define the default search for the Resource Manager role:

steps.instruction: Go to Lists > Search > Saved Searches.
Click Edit next to Resource Search.
In the Search Title field, enter Project Resource Search.
On the Roles tab, find the Resource Manager role and check all the boxes in that row.
Click Save As.

title: To create a skill category:

steps.instruction: Go to Setup > Services > Skill Category > New.

Enter a name for this skill category.

For example, you could create a category named Software to record employees’ skill levels with the types of software your company uses.
On the Skill tab, enter the names of each skill you want included in this category. Click Add after each skill.

On the Skill Level tab, there are three default skill levels provided. You can edit the existing levels by selecting the line you want to edit, making your changes and clicking Done. Add new levels by inserting a line or adding a new line to the bottom of the list. Skill levels should appear in this list from lowest to highest proficiency.

The level you enter here are available for each skill entered on the Skill tab.
When you have finished, click Save.

title: To add skills to an employee or vendor record:

steps.instruction: Go to Lists > Employees > Employees for an employee record or Lists > Relationships > Vendors to update a vendor record.
Click Edit next to the record you want to update.
Click Skills & Expertise.
Enter the number of years of experience for this resource.
On the subtabs, select skills for each skill category and set the skill level. Click Add after each added skill.
On the Portfolio subtab, you can enter social media information and upload a recent resume or work samples.
When you have finished, click Save.

title: To update skills for project resources:

steps.instruction:
While logged in as an administrator go to Lists > Relationships > Resources.

Resource managers can go to Cases > Other Lists > Resources.
Click Edit next to the project resource you want to update.
On the subtabs, select skills for each skill category and set the skill level. Click Add after each added skill.
On the Portfolio subtab, you can enter social media information and upload a recent resume or work samples.
When you have finished, click Save.

title: To search project resources based on skill categories using the resource allocation chart:

steps.instruction:
While logged in as an administrator, go to Lists > Services > Resource Allocation Chart.

Resource Managers can go to Cases > Other Lists > Resource Allocation Chart.

For more information on the resource allocation chart, see Resource Allocation Chart/Grid SuiteApp.
Click New Allocation.
Click the Search icon next to the Resource field.

In the Availability section, select a date range and % Available required for this allocation.

Percent availability is calculated as Unallocated Working Hours / Total Working Hours.
In the Other section, enter additional required criteria, such as billing class, labor cost, and years of experience.
Under Available Skills, select the desired skill and click the arrow to move the skills to the Required Skills box.
When you have finished, click Submit.

title: To derive a pay rate from another payroll item:

steps.instruction: Go to Lists > Employees > Payroll Items.
Click New to create a new payroll item or click Edit beside an existing payroll item that you want to edit. For more information, see Creating Payroll Items.
For an earning payroll item, in the Derived From list, select the payroll item you want to derive the pay rate from.

For a deduction or employer contribution payroll item, in the Derived From Type list, select Payroll Item.

In the Derived From Payroll Item list, select the payroll item you want to derive the pay rate from.

In the Rate Multiplier field, enter the multiplier as a number, not a percentage.

This number can be a decimal fraction, such as 0.25. Negative numbers are also supported.
Click Save.
